titleStmt.title: William P. Moore to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9648

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency B Magoffin
Governor of the Comth of Ky

Your Petitioner would respectfully represent that he was fined for a breach of the pece before A Crocket Esqr thirty dollars on the 27 day of october 1860 the facts are as follows there was an old Judge and upon the settlement there was a little cursing but no licks passed by either party and a packed Jury fined your Petitioner $30 -- wherefor he askes your Excellency to remit Said fine
the undersigned would respectfully aske that your Excellency remit the above fine as we state that Mr Moore is a Quiet peacible man and never has a fuss with any person

E A W. Roberts
M Joyce
Dennis D Hallan
Patrick Cunningham
Ansen Dawson

Franklin
J P
Wm Moore
vs } Petition
commonwealth
Respite 6 mos
B. M
$30 } breach of the Peace
Issd Nov 23 1860
